body_html:
Hello, I resolved my issue. It was hard for me to pin-down exactly what resolved the issue. However, the main component that helped fixing it is the following: the data you read and the python environment should be on the same mount.

In my specific case, the python environment was in my home directory (which resides in some remote mount, to be shared across multiple compute nodes) and the data local to the compute node. After moving everything to be local with respect to the compute node, segfault went away.

Hope that helps someone one day, even though that is quite a specific issue... but for me, time to celebrate 🔥

body:
Hello, I resolved my issue. It was hard for me to pin-down exactly what resolved the issue. However, the main component that helped fixing it is the following: the **data you read and the python environment should be on the same mount**.

In my specific case, the python environment was in my home directory (which resides in some remote mount, to be shared across multiple compute nodes) and the data local to the compute node. After moving everything to be local with respect to the compute node, `segfault` went away.

Hope that helps someone one day, even though that is quite a specific issue... but for me, time to [celebrate](https://youtu.be/whfBUFDuiWo) 🔥
